ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would highly recommend this course to fellow students!I would love to see more courses offered at Yale, like IR 572, which are taught by practitioners.
If you want to learn about public diplomacy from a life-long diplomat and reformer ambassador, you should take this course. Learn the truth about the foreign service and American policy abroad.
I would only recommend this class if you are interested in working as a diplomat or specifically want insight into diplomatic work.

This is a great course for those interested in working in the State Department, and I would recommend it to people considering a State Department career. The course combines academic sources of information (books, articles) with real-life experiences from a career public diplomat.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I think that this course provided me with a different and valuable perspective of the State Department and public diplomacy, but this course did not contribute to my research.
This course deeply contributed to my understanding of public diplomacy. I am very excited about using what I learned this spring semester in my professor endeavors.
This course challenged my beliefs and illuminated public diplomacy.
